Methods

checksum

(
  • id
  • options
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/collection.js:216

Will calculate a checksum of the meta-data (keys and optionally revision ids) and optionally the document data in the collection. The checksum can be used to compare if two collections on different ArangoDB instances contain the same contents. The current revision of the collection is returned too so one can make sure the checksums are calculated for the same state of data.

Parameters:

  • id String
    • the collection handle.
  • options Object
    • JSON Object that can contain each of the following:
    • [withRevisions=false] Boolean optional
      • If true, then revision ids (_rev system attributes) are included in the checksumming.
    • [withData=false] Boolean optional
      • If true, the user-defined document attributes will be included in the calculation too.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

Promise:

create

(
  • collection
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/collection.js:15

Creates a collection

Parameters:

  • collection String
    • the collection name
  • [options] Object optional
    • a JSONObject containing optional attributes:
    • [waitForSync=false] Boolean optional
      • If true then the data is synchronised to disk before returning from a create or update of a document.
    • [doCompact=true] Boolean optional
      • whether or not the collection will be compacted.
    • [type=2] Number optional
      • the type of the collection to create. The following values for type are valid:
        - 2: document collection
        - 3: edges collection
    • [journalSize] Number optional
      • The maximal size of a journal or datafile. Must be at least 1MB.
    • [isSystem=false] Boolean optional

      If true, create a system collection. In this case collectionname should start with an underscore. End users should normally create non-system collections only. API implementors may be required to create system collections in very special occasions, but normally a regular collection will do.

    • [isVolatile=false] Boolean optional

      If true then the collection data is kept in-memory only and not made persistent. Unloading the collection will cause the collection data to be discarded. Stopping or re-starting the server will also cause full loss of data in the collection. Setting this option will make the resulting collection be slightly faster than regular collections because ArangoDB does not enforce any synchronisation to disk and does not calculate any CRC checksums for datafiles.

    • [keyOptions] Object optional
      • additional options for key generation. If specified, then keyOptions should be a JSON array containing the following attributes:
      • [type] String optional
        "traditional" and "autoincrement".
      • [allowUserKeys=false] Boolean optional
        - if set to true, then it is allowed to supply own key values in the _key attribute of a document.
      • [increment] Number optional
        - increment value for autoincrement key generator.
      • [offset] Number optional
        - initial offset value for autoincrement key generator.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

revision

(
  • id
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/collection.js:203

Result contains the collection's revision id. The revision id is a server-generated string that clients can use to check whether data in a collection has changed since the last revision check.

Parameters:

  • id String
    • the collection handle.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

rotate

(
  • id
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/collection.js:243

Rotates the journal of a collection. The current journal of the collection will be closed and made a read-only datafile. The purpose of the rotate method is to make the data in the file available for compaction (compaction is only performed for read-only datafiles, and not for journals).

Parameters:

  • id String
    • the collection handle.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

setProperties

(
  • id
  • properties
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/collection.js:187

Changes the properties of a collection.

Parameters:

  • id String
    • the collection handle.
  • properties Object
    • JSON Object that can contain each of the following:
    • [waitForSync=false] Boolean optional
      • If true then creating or changing a document will wait until the data has been synchronised to disk.
    • [journalSize] Number optional
      • Size (in bytes) for new journal files that are created for the collection.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:
